meanings.definition: Tending to implode or characterized by implosion.
meanings.sent2: The building's implosive demolition was carefully planned.
meanings.sent3: The implosive reaction of the soda can when shaken was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: Her implosive emotions caused her to retreat into herself.
meanings.sent5: The implosive force of the black hole was immense.

meanings.definition: A speech sound produced by implosive consonants.
meanings.sent1: The linguist studied the implosive in the African language.
meanings.sent2: The implosive in the word 'bottle' is unique to certain languages.
meanings.sent3: The implosive in the word 'pop' made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The implosive in his speech captured the audience's attention.
meanings.sent5: The implosive in her pronunciation made the word sound powerful.
